message.content:
cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.CY, cs.CR, cs.HC 

This paper discusses the use of AI in decision making and the potential for bias and discrimination. It proposes a structured approach to mitigate these issues, which falls under the category of AI and machine learning (cs.AI) and could also be relevant to the sub-category of learning (cs.LG). The paper also discusses the ethical and social implications of AI, which could fall under the sub-category of cyber ethics (cs.CY). Additionally, the paper addresses the issue of biased datasets, which could fall under the sub-category of cryptography and security (cs.CR). Finally, the paper focuses on hiring decisions, which could fall under the sub-category of human-computer interaction (cs.HC).
